website_summaries.verdict: Constructed to hold its shape around the edges, preventing risky gaps. But some find the middle softer than they'd like.
pros: Dual-sided foam crib mattress with fiber core
Special edge construction that holds shape and firmly fits in edges for ultimate safety
Toddler side is designed to avoid triggering pressure points
cons: Sagging was an issue for some after only a few months

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Too soft for infant. After 2 months is sagging really bad!

Was much softer than the other which is not recommended for infant so we swapped with my sons mattress that was almost 3 years old. customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Lumpy and saggy

I purchased another mattress because the sagging was just too ridiculous for my son to sleep on for the next couple years. Disappointing buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Milligan

customer_reviews.title: This mattress didn't work for us

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed

My little ones using this mattress are two 25-pound doggies. They use the toddler side, which is softer than the infant side, and they seem very happy to snuggle up together on it.

Built to fit both standard size cribs and toddler beds, its unique infant and toddler sides provide the ideal construction for each phase-firmness for infant's on one side, and convoluted foam comfort on the toddler side to help reduce pressure points. Designed by the same brand that's been leading the way in mattress innovation and technology for more than 80 years, Serta's crib and toddler mattresses deliver the same quality craftsmanship and attention to detail as their adult mattresses.
